Steeve, I don't think Canada is perfect. Far from it. It has it's own problems. However, having spent time in both the US and Canada, I have noticed quite a few differences in our favour. These are nopt meant to be an attack, just observation:
 
 Because of the degree of sex ed kids get in schools up here, as well as very liberal access to condoms, the rates of teens actually getting abortions or pregnant seems to be much lower. I had quite a few american friends as a teen who were always talking about who was pregnant or getting an abortion, etc....
 
 I have attended over 20 schools from k-12 in Canada and I only encountered teen pregnancy twice.
 
 Americans are generally considered to be the most obsese people in the world. Canada is getting a bit chubby, and every so often I get on a bus and someone's thighs are pooling into my seat, but most Canadians, especially on the coast, are leaner and less overweight.
 
 Our degree of serial killers is virtually nothing compared (statistically) to the US. At any given time in the US, 100 serial killers are operating according to FBI estimates (I don't have the time to look up urls, check out the violent crime section website of the FBI in Quantico). I can name the number of serial killers that Canada has had to face since I was born on one hand, if you group Karla Holmolka and Paul Bernardo together (she didn't acutally do the killing, but just as well...)
 
 Most murders in the states are gun related. Most murders in Canada are domestic abuse related. What does this mean to most people? Unless your boyfriend or husband is a jerk, you don't have quite so much to worry about.
 
 Americans, from my experience with tourists, tend to be, on average (so individuals, no taking offense, please) extremly wimpy regarding the elements. Especially cold. The ironic part is that I've heard most of the bitching in BC, which is extremely warm in the winter... I like to see how they'd handle it up NORTH.
 
 Of course there is that little thing about America wanting to buy Canadian water to keep California, which is a desert, fertile. *shakes head*
 
 The drinking age in the US is 21. The drinkig age in most parts of Canada is 18. 
 
 Marijuana has been decriminalized in many parts of Canada and BC is one of the largest marijuana producers in the world (one of).
 
 In many cities, gay marriage is completely legal and sound.
 
 I haven't ever seen a real episode of road rage in Canada in my entire life.
 
 I haven't heard of any whack job bombing an abortion clinic up here.
 
 We don't generally care so much about celebrities, and a lot of movies are shot up here. Americans seem obsessed with celebrities.
 
 We no longer have to say the lord's prayer or in any other way admit to even believing in a God in public K-12 schools.
 
 Canadian Blood Services is one of the safest registries in the world. Elixir of the gods!
 
 Heh... I have to go and give blood in a bit. Talk to you later.
 
 AAW
